intro: Hymenoxys mearnsii, commonly known as the Mearns' hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. Hymenoxys mearnsii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and canyons.
